context_of_use: This use case allows managers to adjust and maintain system settings to customize system behavior.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure system settings are optimized for performance
system operator: Maintain system stability and functionality
description: This use case enables managers to configure system settings to customize the system's behavior according to business needs.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
Manager has the necessary permissions to configure system settings.
postconditions: System settings are updated according to the manager's configurations.
assumptions: The manager has the required access rights to perform configuration.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to configure system settings.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on specific settings that can be configured by the manager.
main_flow: 1. Manager initiates the configuration process → System displays configuration options.
2. Manager selects desired settings to configure → System updates the selected settings.
3. Manager confirms the changes → System saves the new settings and displays a confirmation message.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the manager selects invalid settings, then the system displays an error message and prompts the manager to select valid options.
AF-2 (from Step 3): If the manager decides to cancel the configuration, then the system discards any changes and returns to the previous menu.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the manager lacks permissions, then the system displays an error message and aborts the configuration process.
EF-2 (from Step 2): If the system encounters an error while updating settings, then it displays an error message and reverts to the previous settings.
